best text editor.

Work good on Fedora.

Recommended this programs

love the feature similar to Notepad++ where you don't need to save a document and keep information on several tabs without the need of saving it. But i keep getting the same error message "Notepadqq was not closed properly. Do you want to recover unsaved changes?"
summary: could be smaller and and more stable

description: I am using this on my fedora 38 kde version...and its automatically closes in a few seconds.
Works for the most part as far as I can tell. No obvious / simple way to rename tabs which is a big let down.
summary: No obvious way to rename tabs

description: As of Jan 2024 this project has been abandoned. The existing version has basic functionality, it can launch and open documents but there are many bugs. Code highlighting is not functional, code color themes are not respected when selected from the preferences dialog only showing black and white text, scrolling with the mouse scroll wheel does not work, etc.
does its job, a cool editor with cool features. Dont have a extentions section so im giving 4 stars but it is perfect.
Some update broke it, can't even scroll anymore, themes don't work

I use Notepad++ for html and css coding of web site and like the ability to switch back and fourth between both files being open to edit and create.
This program Notepadqq is a good second alternative in the event you need both the css and html open at the same time for following a stream of coding events.  One thing that would make this program better is a scroll bar on the right side of the gui interface.   Page Up and Page Down work along with arrow keys for moving through a page yet sometimes a scroll bar is more convenient.

If you like Notepadd++ yet do not like using WINE for some reason this program is a possible alternative.
summary: Good altenative for situations where you need two files opened

description: It's amazing! Just like ++.
I was hoping for a solid Notepad++ equivalent, but this isn't it. Copy and Paste do not even work, never mind anything more advanced.
User-friendly and packed with useful features, a very good text editor for an up and coming programmers.
Unusable on 4k laptop screen
This app works just like notepad++; I highly recommend!
It cannot modify run command to run Chrome: It cannot find folder var/www/...
Characters were always selected automatically while I moved mouse. I must uninstall it after trying for 15 minutes.
The app is super good. But 152MB in the snap store??? That's waayy too big. You can download the files yourself in under 3mb
Can not give it beyond a 1 star because it always crashes during start-up no matter how many times I remove and reinstall. Developer needs to fix.
I opted for this one over ++ because ++ isn't native and relies on wine... no thanks. This is just as good.

Some files open as blank and that too in already edited mode. this makes accidental loss of data for that file.
that's a serious issue. can't trust on it with that. uninstalling.
Great tool to work with.
Due to the lack of extensions, I can hardly do anything in this what I can in ++. For example, there appears to be no JSON and YAML formatting.
It has good syntax highlighting and works well!
one of the best editor

Very nice and simple program to use.
I really like it. ?️
still best notepad editor on ubuntu
summary: minor issues but still the best

description: It is good enough for all smaller coding & editing needs. Sits perfectly between lighter gedits/nanos and heavier IDEs like VS/Eclipse/IntelliJ. Pretty much like Notepad++, but without annoying Wine requirements.

It gives me the same good experience as Notepad++, nothing less! Download it!

I only gave it 4/5 because it starts up really slow. Not sure if this is because of Qt or poor optimization.

i tried open this app and not open and retry in terminal and error in the line is This application failed to start because it could not find or load the Qt platform plugin "wayland-egl".
Available platform plugins are: eglfs, linuxfb, minimal, minimalegl, offscreen, xcb.
Reinstalling the application may fix this problem.
Aborted
i need solution please

The app "works", the problem is it doesn't recognize the owner of the files or the permissions given to them. If I want to mod a file in my home folder, and it's a file I can mod as much as I want with text or gedit, with NPQQ I have to first move it to another folder, mod it there, and copy it back to where I need it. To much of a hassle for an app I hoped it would help me be more organized with it's colors. If this doesn't bother you, then the app is awesome.
is very helpful
Makes switching from Windows to Ubuntu much easier
very good application.

description: All of these comments, saying it doesnt work on Ubuntu Jammy (22.04), confuses me, it works for me fine. If anyone reading this that posted a "doesnt work" review, try running nodepadqq from terminal ("snap run notepadqq"). might give you an idea whats wrong. Im running the stable version (v1.4.8) and it works just fine for me, no troubleshooting needed.

snap run notepadqq  results in 
This application failed to start because it could not find or load the Qt platform plugin "wayland-egl".

Available platform plugins are: eglfs, linuxfb, minimal, minimalegl, offscreen, xcb.

Reinstalling the application may fix this problem.
Aborted (core dumped)

Reinstalling does NOT help.

snap run notepadqq
This application failed to start because it could not find or load the Qt platform plugin "wayland-egl".

Available platform plugins are: eglfs, linuxfb, minimal, minimalegl, offscreen, xcb.

i tried it several times but it was to no avail...it simply doesn't work in Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. I used the SNAP instead to install a copy of NOTEPAD++ for code editing in my laptop. Using the Ubuntu terminal (command-line interface), invoke the command:

$ sudo snap install notepad-plus-plus
summary: it doesn't work in Ubuntu 22.04 LTS

description:
Programm startet, dauert beim ersten Mal nur deutlich länger. Der zweite Start dann nach 2-3 Sekunden.
Design im Vergleich zu Notepad Next (neuere QT Version) erinnert bisschen an Wine-emulierte Windows Software. Im Vergleich zu Notepad Next sind allerdings mehr Einstellungen verfügbar und die Auswahl der Zeicheninterpretation (NN steht irgendwie fest auf UTF-8).
Geht mir ähnlich wie einem meiner Vorrezensenten - das Programm startet nicht, selbst nach einem Neustart des Rechners.
summary: Lässt sich nicht starten / does not start (2.0)

description:
Ein Programm das nicht mal startet hat keinen Wert und belegt wertvollen Speicherplatz.
Also weg damit und deinstallieren.
Programm startet nicht. Wieder deinstalliert.
Der erste Start dauert Ewigkeiten. Dann sieht das ganze aus, wie ein WIndows Programm unter Wine. Layout und Textgröße nicht an meine EInstellungen angepasst.
summary: Erster Start dauert ewig und Text viel zu klein
